intro: Desmochaeta densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered desmochaeta, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense arrangement of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Native to certain regions of South America, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species within its native habitat and of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
